ray.rage.scene.generic

Class GenericSceneNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • ray.rage.scene.generic.GenericSceneNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Managed<SceneManager>, Nameable, Node, SceneNode

    final class GenericSceneNode
extends java.lang.Object
implements SceneNode
    A generic implementation of a scene-node for use with the scene-manager. This implementation makes no assumptions about how the space in a scene is partitioned, if at all.

    Note that implementations may cause a subtle degree of (unavoidable) coupling with render-system implementations, specifically related to the internal details of the coordinate systems they use.

    For example, +Z/+X axes in OpenGL and Vulkan point in the same direction. However, Vulkan's +Y axis points down the screen, which is the opposite of OpenGL. Details like these should be dealt with in the render-system implementations and their shaders, not in the nodes or the scene-manager.

    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface ray.rage.scene.Node

      • createChildSceneNode

        public SceneNode createChildSceneNode(java.lang.String name)
        Description copied from interface: SceneNode
        Creates a new child for this scene-node.

        Since scene-nodes are aware of the manager that created them, implementations use SceneManager.createSceneNode(String) when instantiating children. This allows the manager to remain aware of all the scene-nodes.

        Specified by:
        createChildSceneNode in interface SceneNode
        Parameters:
        name - A unique name for the child.
        Returns:
        A new scene-node.

      • attachChild

        public void attachChild(Node child)
        Description copied from interface: Node
        Adds a node as a child of this node. The child is automatically notified via Node.notifyAttached(Node).

        A child can have only one parent. If it's already attached to another node, it must be detached first.

        Specified by:
        attachChild in interface Node
        Parameters:
        child - The node to be a child of this one.
        See Also:
        Node.detachChild(Node), Node.notifyAttached(Node)

      • notifyAttached

        public void notifyAttached(Node newParent)
        Description copied from interface: Node
        Tells this node that it has been attached to the specified parent. If this node has a Node.Listener and its new parent is different to the current one, then it emits Node.Listener#onNodeAttached(Node). If both the new and current parents are the same, then no "re-parenting" has really taken place and the listener does nothing.

        The root node does not have a parent. Adding a parent to the root node wouldn't make sense and could cause infinite cycles through the graph.

        WARNING: This method is meant to be used internally by the framework and not by game clients. Use directly only if you really know what you're doing.

        Specified by:
        notifyAttached in interface Node
        Parameters:
        newParent - The new parent for this node.
        See Also:
        Node.attachChild(Node), Node.notifyDetached()

      • notifyDetached

        public void notifyDetached()
        Description copied from interface: Node
        Tells this node that it has been detached from its current parent. If this node has a Node.Listener and a non-null parent, then it emits Node.Listener#onNodeDetached(Node). If this node was already detached, then the listener does nothing.

        WARNING: This method is meant to be used internally by the framework and not by game clients. Use directly only if you really know what you're doing.

        Specified by:
        notifyDetached in interface Node
        See Also:
        Node.detachChild(Node), Node.notifyAttached(Node)

      • notifyRootNode

        public void notifyRootNode()
        Description copied from interface: SceneNode
        Notifies this scene-node that it is the root node.

        WARNING: This method is meant to be used internally by the framework and not by game clients. Only the scene-manager should use this.

        Specified by:
        notifyRootNode in interface SceneNode

      • update

        public void update()
        Description copied from interface: Node
        Updates the node and automatically causes updates to propagate through the graph. This node will let its children know if it has changed in some way, so that the children can know whether they need to update themselves. 
         boolean changed = parentHasChanged || thisHasChanged;
 node.update(true, changed);
        Specified by:
        update in interface Node
        See Also:
        Node.update(boolean, boolean)

      • update

        public void update(boolean updateChildren,
                   boolean parentHasChanged)
        Description copied from interface: Node
        Updates the node and (optionally) causes the updates to propagate through the graph.
        Specified by:
        update in interface Node
        Parameters:
        updateChildren - If true, the update cascades down to all children. False otherwise. Specific SceneManager implementations may want to update nodes manually.
        parentHasChanged - This flag indicates that the parent transform has changed and that the child should retrieve the parent's transform to combine it with its own, even if it hasn't changed itself.

      • updateFromParent

        public void updateFromParent()
        Description copied from interface: Node
        Update this node's transforms using its parent's derived transforms.
        Specified by:
        updateFromParent in interface Node

      • isInSceneGraph

        public boolean isInSceneGraph()
        Description copied from interface: SceneNode
        Checks whether this scene-node is in the scene graph or not.

        A scene-node is in the scene graph when there's an unbroken link between this scene-node all the way to its ultimate ancestor, the root scene-node.

        Specified by:
        isInSceneGraph in interface SceneNode
        Returns:
        True if this scene-node is in the scene graph. Otherwise false.

      • notifyInSceneGraph

        public void notifyInSceneGraph(boolean inGraph)
        Description copied from interface: SceneNode
        Notifies this scene-node whether it's in the scene graph or not.

        A scene-node is in the scene graph when there's an unbroken link between this scene-node all the way to its ultimate ancestor, the root scene-node.

        WARNING: This method is meant to be used internally by the framework and not by game clients. Use directly only if you really know what you're doing.

        Specified by:
        notifyInSceneGraph in interface SceneNode
        Parameters:
        inGraph - True if this scene-node is in the scene graph. Otherwise false.

      • attachObject

        public void attachObject(SceneObject obj)
        Description copied from interface: SceneNode
        Attaches a scene-object to this scene-node.

        The scene-node is responsible for notifying the scene-object that it just got attached by invoking its SceneObject.notifyAttached(SceneNode) method.

        Specified by:
        attachObject in interface SceneNode
        Parameters:
        obj - The scene-object being attached.

      • detachAllObjects

        public void detachAllObjects()
        Description copied from interface: SceneNode
        Detaches all the scene-objects from this scene-node, without destroying them.

        The scene-node is responsible for notifying all scene-objects that they just got detached by invoking their SceneObject.notifyDetached() method.

        Specified by:
        detachAllObjects in interface SceneNode
